title: Gold-Standard Rubric Structure
purpose: Provide clear, consistent, and fair assessment guidelines aligned with ideal answers and learning objectives.

frameworks.name: Bloom's Taxonomy
frameworks.description: Classifies cognitive skills from recall to creation.

frameworks.description: Five levels of understanding, from Prestructural to Extended Abstract.

details: Map each criterion to specific outcomes.
Use clear action verbs from Bloom's.
Limit criteria and levels for usability.
Frame levels as stages of mastery.
Consistency across raters; fairness for students.

steps: Write a scientifically accurate ideal answer.
No title and purpose needed in the output.
Develop performance bands: Comprehensive, Competent, Partial, Limited.
Map bands to ideal answer elements.

example_rubric.question: For each of the following endocrine glands, name a hormone it secretes and give its corresponding function: Thyroid and Adrenals.

levels.description: Correctly names both hormones (thyroxine and adrenaline) and details their function in metabolism (thyroxine stimulates metabolism) and the fight or flight response (adrenaline increases heart rate, expands air passages, and boosts glucose release).
Correctly names both hormones (thyroxine and adrenaline) with generally accurate functions but needs to expand on the detail of their function.
One hormone is named correctly and/or functions are incomplete or not stated.
Hormones and functions are incorrect, missing, or unclear. Scientific understanding not demonstrated.
